datelife 0.3.0

  • Reference

Reference

All functions

HPDbars()

Function from phyloch package Add interval bars to nodes on a phylo plot.

axisGeo()

Function from Christoph Heibl's phyloch package Add a Geological Time Axis for Time-Calibrated Phylogenies.

birds_and_cats

A multiPhylo object with trees resulting from a datelife search of some birds and cats species

build_grove_list()

Build grove list

build_grove_matrix()

Build grove matrix

check_conflicting_calibrations()

function to check for conflicting calibrations if calibrations are younger or older relative to descendants and ancestors, respectively

check_datelife_result()

checks if we obtained an empty search with the set of input taxon names

check_ott_input()

Checks input for get_ott_clade, get_ott_children functions, get_otol_synthetic_tree

choose_cluster()

Choose an ultrametric phylo object from cluster_patristicmatrix obtained with a particular clustering method, or the next best tree. If there are not any ultrametric trees, it does not force them.

classification_paths_from_taxonomy()

Gets classification paths for a vector of taxa

clean_ott_chronogram()

Clean up some issues with OToL chronograms For now it 1) checks unmapped taxa and maps them with tnrs_match.phylo, 2) roots the chronogram if unrooted

clean_taxon_info_children()

Identifies, extracts and cleans children names from a taxonomy_taxon_info() output

clean_tnrs()

Eliminates unmatched (NAs) and invalid taxa from a rotl::tnrs_match_names or datelife::tnrs_match output Useful to get ott ids to retrieve an otol induced subtree from. Needed because using include_suppressed = FALSE in tnrs_match_names does not drop all invalid taxa

cluster_patristicmatrix()

Cluster a patristic matrix into a tree with various methods.

contributor_cache

Information on contributors, authors, study ids and clades from studies with chronograms in Open tree of Life

date_with_pbdb()

Date with Paleobiology Database and paleotree

datelife_authors_tabulate()

Return the relevant authors for a set of studies

datelife_query_check()

checks if input is a datelifeQuery object, otherwise it uses make_datelife_query to process it

datelife_result_MRCA()

Get vector of MRCAs from a datelifeResult object. Used in: summarize_datelife_result.

datelife_result_check()

checks if we obtained an empty search with the set of input taxon names

datelife_result_median()

Get a median summary chronogram from a datelifeResult object.

datelife_result_median_matrix()

Function to compute median matrix of a datelifeResult object.

datelife_result_sdm()

Function to compute the SDM supertree (Criscuolo et al. 2006) from a datelifeResult object.

datelife_result_study_index()

Find the index of relevant studies in a opentree_chronograms object. Used inside: summarize_datelife_result.

datelife_result_variance_matrix()

Function to compute variance matrix of a datelifeResult object.

datelife_search()

Core function to input a vector of species, newick string, or phylo object to get a chronogram or dates back.

.get_ott_lineage()

Gets the lineage of a set of taxa using rotl:taxonomy_taxon_info(include_lineage = TRUE)

felid_gdr_phylo_all

datelifeSummary of a datelifeResult object of all Felidae species.

felid_sdm

SDM tree of a datelifeResult object of all Felidae species.

filter_for_grove()

Filter a datelifeResult object to find the largest grove

force_ultrametric()

Force a non ultrametric phylo object to be ultrametric

geostellar

Table of geological ages and time before earth formation Goldblatt et al. 2010 doi:10.5194/se-1-1-2010

get_all_calibrations()

Get all calibrations from chronograms in a database (specified in cache).

get_best_grove()

Get grove from a datelifeResult object that can be converted to phylo from a median summary matrix.

get_biggest_phylo()

Get the tree with the most tips: the biggest tree

get_dated_otol_induced_subtree()

Get an otol induced dated subtree from your set of queried taxa

get_datelife_result()

Go from a vector of species, newick string, or phylo object to a list of patristic matrices

get_fossil_range()

Get the ages for a taxon from PBDB

get_goodmatrices()

Get good matrices for SDM

get_mrbayes_node_constraints()

Makes a node constraints and node calibrations block for a MrBayes run file from a list of taxa and ages or from a dated tree

get_otol_chronograms()

Get all chronograms from Open Tree of Life

get_otol_synthetic_tree()

Gets Open Tree of Life synthetic tree of a set of lineages.

get_ott_children()

Use this instead of rotl::tol_subtree when taxa are not in synthesis tree and you still need to get all species or an induced otol subtree

get_ott_clade()

Gets the ott id and name of one or several given taxonomic ranks from one or more input taxa

get_ott_lineage()

Gets the ott id and name of all lineages from one or more input taxa

get_sdm()

Get SDM result for list of working matrices.

get_sdm_matrix()

Get good matrices for SDM

get_subset_array_dispatch()

Figure out which subset function to use. Used inside: get_datelife_result

get_taxon_summary()

Get taxon summary of a datelifeResult object

get_valid_children()

Extracts valid children from a set of input names or ott ids (not from a taxonomy taxon info object)

input_process()

Takes a phylo object or a character string and figure out if it's correct newick format or a list of species

is_good_chronogram()

Check to see that a tree is a valid chronogram

is_n_overlap()

Function for computing n overlap for two vectors of names (ie., phy1$tip.label, phy2$tip.label) and seeing if they have n overlap

ltt_summary()

Lineage through time plots of all chronograms in multiphylo object and its summaries.

make_all_associations()

Find all authors and where they have deposited their trees

make_bladj_tree()

Takes a tree and uses bladj to estimate node ages and branch lengths given a set of fixed node ages and respective node names

make_bold_otol_tree()

Use Barcode of Life Data (BOLD) to get branch lengths on a tree topology. If input is not a tree, then it uses the OToL tree of the set of input taxa.

make_contributor_cache()

Create a cache from Open Tree of Life

make_datelife_query()

Cleans taxon names from input character vector, phylo object or newick character string. Process the two latter with input_process first.

make_mrbayes_runfile()

Makes a mrBayes run block file with a constraint topology and a set of node calibrations and missing taxa.

make_mrbayes_tree()

Takes a constraint tree and uses mrBayes to get node ages and branch lengths given a set of node calibrations without any data.

make_otol_associations()

Associate OToL authors with studies

make_overlap_table()

Create an overlap table

make_treebase_associations()

Associate TreeBase authors with studies

make_treebase_cache()

Create a cache from TreeBase

map_nodes_ott()

Add Open Tree of Life Taxonomy to tree nodes.

match_all_calibrations()

Map calibrations to nodes of a tree topology

missing_taxa_check()

Checks that missing_taxa argument is ok to be used by make_mrbayes_runfile inside tree_add_dates functions.

opentree_chronograms

Chronograms in Open Tree of Life and other related data

patristic_matrix_MRCA()

Get time of MRCA from patristic matrix. Used in: datelife_result_MRCA.

patristic_matrix_list_to_array()

Convert list of patristic matrices to a 3D array. Used inside: summarize_datelife_result, patristic_matrix_array_congruify.

patristic_matrix_name_reorder()

Function to reorder a matrix so that row and column labels are in alphabetical order. Used in: patristic_matrix_pad.

patristic_matrix_pad()

Function to fill in empty cells in a patristic matrix for missing taxa. Used in: patristic_matrix_list_to_array.

patristic_matrix_taxa_all_matching()

Are all desired taxa in the patristic_matrix? Used inside: results_list_process.

patristic_matrix_to_newick()

Convert patristic matrix to a newick string. Used inside: summarize_datelife_result.

patristic_matrix_to_phylo()

Convert patristic matrix to a phylo object. Used inside: summarize_datelife_result, CongruifyTree.

patristic_matrix_unpad()

Function to remove missing taxa from a datelifeResult object. Used in: datelife_result_sdm.

phylo_check()

Checks if phy is a phylo class object and/or a chronogram

phylo_generate_uncertainty()

Function to generate uncertainty in branch lengths using a lognormal

phylo_get_node_numbers()

Gets node numbers from any phylogeny

phylo_has_brlen()

Check for branch lengths in a tree

phylo_height_omi()

get the outer margin of a graphics device from a number of tips

phylo_tiplabel_space_to_underscore()

Convert spaces to underscores in trees. Used in: make_mrbayes_runfile, get_mrbayes_node_calibrations, tree_get_singleton_outgroup, congruify_and_check, patristic_matrix_array_phylo_congruify.

phylo_tiplabel_underscore_to_space()

Convert underscores to spaces in trees. Used inside: patristic_matrix_array_phylo_congruify, congruify_and_check.

pick_grove()

Pick a grove in the case of multiple groves in a set of trees.

plant_bold_otol_tree

Some plants chronogram

plot_densitree()

get a densiTree plot from a set of opentree_chronograms if densiTree plot function throws an error, it chooses the tree with the most tips as consensus (using get_biggest_phylo) we found that densiTree errors commonly from failing to do a consensus tree.

plot_ltt_phyloall()

Easy visualization of lineage through time plots of all chronograms in a multiphylo object.

plot_ltt_summary()

Lineage through time plots of all chronograms in multiphylo object and its summaries.

plot_phylo()

plot one tree with study title and geochronological axis

plot_phylo_all()

plot all trees with study titles and geochronological axis

problems

Problematic chronograms from Open Tree of Life

recover_mrcaott()

Gets an mrcaott tag from an open tree of life tree and gets its name and ott id

relevant_curators_tabulate()

Return the relevant curators for a set of studies

results_list_process()

Take results_list and process it. Used inside: get_datelife_result

run()

Core function to generate results

run_mrbayes()

Runs MrBayes from R.

sample_trees()

Function to sample trees from a file containing multiple trees. Usually from a bayesian analysis output trees file.

save_otol_chronograms()

Save all chronograms from Open Tree of Life

some_ants_datelife_result

datelifeResult object of some ants

strat2012

A data frame containing the stratigraphic chart by issued in 2012 by the International Commission on Stratigraphy.

subset2_search

A list with datelieQuery and datelifeResult objects from a search of taxon names from subset2_taxa

subset2_taxa

Long list of >2.7k virus, bacteria, plant and animal taxon names

subset_trees()

subset trees for plotting densitree plots and phylo_all plots

summarize_datelife_result()

Summarize a filtered results list from get_datelife_result function in various ways

summarize_fossil_range()

Summarize taxon age from PBDB to just a single min and max age

summarize_summary_matrix()

Internal for summary_matrix_to_phylo().

summary(<datelifeResult>)

Main function to summarize a datelifeResult object

summary_matrix_to_phylo()

Go from a summary matrix to an ultrametric phylo object.

summary_matrix_to_phylo_all()

function to get min, mean and max summary chronograms from a summary matrix of a datelifeResult object.

summary_patristic_matrix_array()

Summarize patristic matrix array (by default, median). Used inside: summarize_datelife_result.

threebirds_dr

datelifeResult object of three birds "Rhea americana", "Pterocnemia pennata", and "Struthio camelus"

tnrs_match()

Taxon name resolution service (tnrs) applied to a vector of names by batches.

tree_add_dates()

Fabricates dates of missing taxa (with no data) on an already dated tree.

tree_add_nodelabels()

Adds labels to nodes with no assigned label

tree_add_outgroup()

Function to add an outgroup to any phylogeny, in phylo or newick format

tree_check()

Checks if a tree is a phylo class object otherwise it uses input_process. Additionally it can check if tree is a chronogram with phylo_check

tree_fix_brlen()

Takes a tree with branch lengths and fixes negative or zero length branches in several ways

tree_from_taxonomy()

Gets a taxonomic tree from a vector of taxa

tree_get_node_data()

Gets node numbers, node names, descendant tip numbers and labels of nodes from a any tree and node ages from dated trees

tree_get_singleton_outgroup()

Identifies the presence of a single lineage outgroup in a phylogeny.

tree_node_tips()

To get tip numbers descending from any given node of a tree

treebase_cache

Information on contributors, authors, study ids and clades from studies with chronograms in Open tree of Life

update_all_cached()

Update all cached files for the package

update_datelife_cache()

update Open Tree of Life cache

use_all_calibrations()

Perform a dating analysis on a set of input taxa. It searches and uses all calibrations from chronograms in the DateLife database.

use_calibrations()

Perform a dating analysis on a tree topology using a determined set of calibrations.

use_calibrations_bladj()

Use calibrations to date a topology with bladj.

use_calibrations_pathd8()

Use calibrations to date a tree with branch lengths with PATHd8.

use_calibrations_treePL()

Use calibrations to date a tree with branch lengths with treePL.

use_each_calibration()

Use calibrations from each source chronogram to date a tree.

wrap_string_to_plot()

wrap a character string to a plotting area. It gives the optimal cex and width. It works once plot device has been called idea to use strwrap from https://stackoverflow.com/questions/7367138/text-wrap-for-plot-titles

Contents

  • All functions
